required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diagnosis and Intervention of Complicated Twin Diseases
clinical_study.official_title: Diagnosis and Intervention of Complicated Twin Diseases in China

brief_summary.textblock: Fetal medicine in China is still a new, young discipline, and the development is very rapid. After nearly 10 years of development, the clinical diagnosis and treatment guidelines of some complicated twin diseases has been established , but they are still needed to be improved. Through this study, the investigators expect to achieve better prediction indicators and early intrauterine precise diagnosis of complicated twin diseases. Also, better procedures of implementing effective intrauterine intervention and assessing the safety and effectiveness of intrauterine intervention are anticipated to be established.

detailed_description.textblock: A better guideline for complicated twin diseases are anticipated to be established in China. Molecular genetics and imaging technology are applied to evaluate the outcome and prognosis of intrauterine intervention for complex twin diseases. 3D printing technology is used to assist the preoperative evaluation of fetal intrauterine intervention. Better fetal intrauterine intervention technique and prognosis evaluation are expected to be established.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Pregnancy women with complicated twin diseases, who are able to withstand risks of intrauterine treatments and informed consent.

primary_outcome.description: DNA methylation, histone acetylation etc. assessed by analyses of fetal blood and amniotic fluid.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of volume of amniotic fluid in Milliliter
primary_outcome.time_frame: At every two week from the sixteenth week of gestational age to delivery of babies

primary_outcome.measure: Change of umbilical artery blood flow
primary_outcome.time_frame: At every two week from the sixteenth week of gestational age to delivery of babies

secondary_outcome.description: Including adaptive, gross motor, fine motor, language, and social function; assessed using Gesell Developmental Schedules.

arm_group.description: Pregnancy women with complicated twin diseases, who are able to withstand risks of intrauterine treatments and informed consent, will be involved. Fetoscope technique will be administered in suitable patients.

intervention.description: Intrauterine intervention with fetoscope technique will be applied to treat complex twin diseases with intention to improve the prognosis of patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy women with complicated twin diseases who are able to withstand intrauterine treatment and consent informed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy women who refuse intrauterine treatment.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of the second obstetrical department
